name: Mise
text: Name a nonland card, then reveal the top card of your library. If that card is the named card, draw three cards.

editions.flavor: Statistically mind-staggering as it might seem, the term "mise" was in fact coined simultaneously by over one thousand Magic players.

mise 'miz v alter. of might as well (1997) 1: to win when you don't deserve to 2: to top-deck the "tings" you need 3: to be rewarded by an opponent's bad luck 4: to coin a phrase that spreads through the tournament scene like wildfire 5: to fling a monkey 6: to split firewood using a sharp instrument 7: To burn

name: Misers' Cage
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has five or more cards in hand, Misers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"Let him be imprisoned while his possessions wander free."
—Suq'Ata legal decree

name: Misery Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Cleric.
• Return target Cleric card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target player loses 2 life.

name: Misfortune
text:
An opponent chooses one —
• You put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and gain 4 life.
• You put a -1/-1 counter on each creature that player controls and Misfortune deals 4 damage to him or her.

name: Misfortune's Gain
text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

editions.flavor: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.
The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

name: Misguided Rage
text: Target player sacrifices a permanent.

editions.flavor: Only when the anger passed did Varv realize he had burned down his home, destroyed his weapons, and killed his friend Furt.

name: Mishra
text: If a creature you control would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.

editions.flavor: Both complement and antithesis to his older brother Urza, Mishra also mastered the intricacies of artifice. It was Mishra's strength that first gave rise to the massive Phyrexian war engines on Dominaria, and it was his weakness that pushed him, Urza, and Dominaria itself to the point of annihilation.

name: Mishra, Artificer Prodigy
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may search your graveyard, hand, and/or library for a card with the same name as that spell and put it onto the battlefield. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

editions.flavor: A sojourn through time gave dark inspiration to one gifted young mind.

name: Mishra's Bauble
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Bauble: Look at the top card of target player's library. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Arcum is a babbling fool Phyrexian technology is our greatest blessing. Take this delightful trinket for instance . . ."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Mishra's Factory
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Groundbreaker: Target land becomes a 3/3 artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.
The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.

name: Mishra's Helix
text: {X}, {T}: Tap X target lands.

editions.flavor: The helix was the finest example of Mishra's campaign strategy: if he couldn't have Argoth, no one could.

name: Mishra's Toy Workshop
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only on spells and abilities that put tokens onto the battlefield. Use toys to represent the tokens.

editions.flavor: Even though Urza tried to apologize, Mishra continued to bear a grudge.

name: Mishra's War Machine
text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

name: Mishra's Workshop
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells.

editions.flavor: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.
Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.
Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.

name: Misinformation
text: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order.

editions.flavor: "When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts." —Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

"When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

name: Miss Demeanor
text:
Flying, first strike
During each other player's turn, compliment that player on his or her game play or sacrifice Miss Demeanor.

editions.flavor: Even war can be civil.

name: Misshapen Fiend
text: Flying

editions.flavor: You'd scarcely believe they could fly until they drop out of the sky onto you.

name: Misstep
text: Creatures target player controls don't untap during that player's next untap step.

editions.flavor:
The feet have no eyes.
—Saprazzan saying

name: Mistbind Clique
text:
Flash
Flying
Champion a Faerie (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Faerie you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
When a Faerie is championed with Mistbind Clique, tap all lands target player controls.

name: Mistblade Shinobi
text:
Ninjutsu {U} ({U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Mistblade Shinobi deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand.

name: Mistcutter Hydra
text:
Mistcutter Hydra can't be countered.
Haste, protection from blue
Mistcutter Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Mist Dragon
text:
{0}: Mist Dragon gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{0}: Mist Dragon loses flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}{U}: Mist Dragon phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor:
"Across the plains, farmers who braved the mists began to vanish. Most blamed the goblins; none guessed the truth."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Mistfire Adept
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The quieter the skies, the calmer the mind."

name: Mistfire Weaver
text:
Flying
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Mistfire Weaver is turned face up, target creature you control gains hexproof until end of turn.

name: Mistfolk
text: {U}: Counter target spell that targets Mistfolk.

editions.flavor:
"Although my official log will state there is no evidence pointing to the existence of the Mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition's eyewitness accounts."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

"Although my official log will state there is no evidence pointing to the existence of the Mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition's eyewitness accounts."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Mistform Dreamer
text:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Dreamer becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Devotion, the second myth of reality: The faithful are most hurt by the objects of their faith.

name: Mistform Mask
text:
Enchant creature
{1}: Enchanted creature becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Trust, the fifth myth of reality: Every truth holds the seed of betrayal.

name: Mistform Mutant
text: {1}{U}: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Target creature becomes that type until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Familiarity, the first myth of reality: What you know the best, you observe the least.

name: Mistform Seaswift
text:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Seaswift becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
Morph {1}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Mistform Shrieker
text:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Shrieker becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
Morph {3}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Mistform Skyreaver
text:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Skyreaver becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Conviction, the third myth of reality: Only those who seek the truth can be deceived.

name: Mistform Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{1}: This permanent becomes the creature type of your choice in addition to its other types until end of turn."

editions.flavor: Taking the form of a junior researcher, the first sliver slipped out of Riptide.

name: Mistform Stalker
text:
{1}: Mistform Stalker becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
{2}{U}{U}: Mistform Stalker gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

name: Mistform Ultimus
text: Mistform Ultimus is every creature type (even if this card isn't on the battlefield).

editions.flavor: It may wear your face, but its mind is its own.
It may wear your face, but its mind is its own.

name: Mistform Wakecaster
text:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Wakecaster becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Choose a creature type. Each creature you control becomes that type until end of turn.

name: Mistform Wall
text:
Mistform Wall has defender as long as it's a Wall.
{1}: Mistform Wall becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Fellowship, the fourth myth of reality: As the tides of war shift, so do loyalties.

name: Mistform Warchief
text:
Creature spells you cast that share a creature type with Mistform Warchief cost {1} less to cast.
{T}: Mistform Warchief becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.

name: Misthollow Griffin
text:
Flying
You may cast Misthollow Griffin from exile.

editions.flavor: For some creatures, existing is only a whim.

name: Misthoof Kirin
text:
Flying, vigilance
Megamorph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: It heralded Sarkhan's return to Tarkir's present.

name: Mist Intruder
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Flying
Ingest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)

editions.flavor: The wastes spread as quickly as the wind.

name: Mist Leopard
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor:
"I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Mistmeadow Skulk
text: Lifelink, protection from converted mana cost 3 or greater

editions.flavor: Doyo suspected the boggarts of brewing a plot against his crop, so he scythed away his grain to clear the sightlines.
Doyo suspected the boggarts of brewing a plot against his crop, so he scythed away his grain to clear the sightlines.

name: Mistmeadow Witch
text: {2}{W}{U}: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: Olka collected the evening mist for years, studying its secrets. Once she learned its essence, she could vanish with a thought.
Olka collected the evening mist for years, studying its secrets. Once she learned its essence, she could vanish with a thought.

text:
Flying

text:
Permanents don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses a permanent for each card in his or her graveyard, then untaps those permanents.

name: Mistral Charger
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Some sky steeds break from the thundering herd to ride free on the open winds.
Some sky steeds break from the thundering herd to ride free on the open winds.

name: Mist Raven
text:
Flying
When Mist Raven enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"When you see a raven, head for the hills. It knows when the ghost-tide is headed in."

text:
You may pay {1} and return a basic land you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Mistvein Borderpost's mana cost.

name: Misty Rainforest
text: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Misty Rainforest: Search your library for a Forest or Island card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Mitotic Manipulation
text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser

name: Mitotic Slime
text: When Mitotic Slime dies, create two 2/2 green Ooze creature tokens. They have "When this creature dies, create two 1/1 green Ooze creature tokens."

name: Mizzium Meddler
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Mizzium Meddler enters the battlefield, you may change a target of target spell or ability to Mizzium Meddler.

editions.flavor: Energy surges in Izzet labs are opportunities for experimentation.
Energy surges in Izzet labs are opportunities for experimentation.

name: Mizzium Mortars
text:
Mizzium Mortars deals 4 damage to target creature you don't control.
Overload {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

name: Mizzium Skin
text:
Target creature you control gets +0/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn.
Overload {1}{U} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

text:
{3}: Mizzium Transreliquat becomes a copy of target artifact until end of turn.
{1}{U}{R}: Mizzium Transreliquat becomes a copy of target artifact and gains this ability.

editions.flavor:
"What is it? Um . . . what do you want it to be?"
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

name: Mizzix of the Izmagnus
text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell with converted mana cost greater than the number of experience counters you have, you get an experience counter.
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each experience counter you have.

name: Mizzix's Mastery
text:
Exile target card that's an instant or sorcery from your graveyard. For each card exiled this way, copy it, and you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost. Exile Mizzix's Mastery.
Overload {5}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

name: Mnemonic Nexus
text: Each player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

editions.flavor: True enlightenment comes not with a new thought, but with understanding of all the old ones.

name: Mnemonic Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."

editions.flavor:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Mnemonic Wall
text:
Defender
When Mnemonic Wall enters the battlefield, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"I'd build an entire fortress of them if I could."

name: Moaning Spirit
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The dead sing their own lullabies.

name: Moan of the Unhallowed
text:
Create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: For a ghoul, every village is a buffet and every disaster is a reunion.
For a ghoul, every village is a buffet and every disaster is a reunion.

name: Moat
text: Creatures without flying can't attack.

editions.flavor: The purpose of any moat is to impede attack. Some are filled with water, some with thistles. Some are filled with things best left unseen.
The purpose of any moat is to impede attack. Some are filled with water, some with thistles. Some are filled with things best left unseen.

name: Mobile Fort
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{3}: Mobile Fort gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Mobile Garrison
text:
Whenever Mobile Garrison attacks, untap another target artifact or creature you control.
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

name: Mobilization
text:
Soldier creatures have vigilance.
{2}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.

editions.flavor: Wars are won with strength, valor, and numbers—especially numbers.
Newcomers to Otaria find themselves at the bottom of the heap. In the pits, they at least have the chance to climb atop a heap of bodies.
Wars are won with strength, valor, and numbers—especially numbers.

name: Mobilize
text: Untap all creatures you control.

editions.flavor: A rested mind is the sharpest weapon.

name: Mob Justice
text: Mob Justice deals damage to target player equal to the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor: A single stone can start an avalanche.

name: Mob Mentality
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.
Whenever all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Why is loud stupidity so infectious?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Mob Rule
text:
Choose one —
• Gain control of all creatures with power 4 or greater until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.
• Gain control of all creatures with power 3 or less until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.

name: Mockery of Nature
text:
Emerge {7}{G} (You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature's converted mana cost.)
When you cast Mockery of Nature, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

name: Mogg Alarm
text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Mogg Alarm's mana cost.
Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

editions.flavor: They make mountains into mogg holes.

name: Mogg Assassin
text: {T}: You choose target creature an opponent controls, and that opponent chooses target creature. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature you chose. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature your opponent chose.

name: Mogg Bombers
text: When another creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Mogg Bombers and it deals 3 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Behind every great mogg bomber is another mogg with a shovel and a basket.

name: Mogg Cannon
text: {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: Moggs never volunteer for anything twice.

name: Moggcatcher
text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Goblin permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "They're not worth much, but they're easy to catch."

name: Mogg Conscripts
text: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.

editions.flavor:

Hey, wake up

editions.flavor: Stand clear if he gets an itch.

name: Mogg Raider
text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.
The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.

name: Mogg Salvage
text:
If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Mountain, you may cast Mogg Salvage without paying its mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: Three moggs, one treasure, too bad.

name: Mogg Sentry
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Nobody stands in one place better than a mogg."
—Tahngarth
Nothing makes a mogg madder than having to wake up.
Tortured with magic by their masters, the moggs are enflamed by the smell of sorcery.

name: Mogg Squad
text: Mogg Squad gets -1/-1 for each other creature on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: As they crept into the Weatherlight's hold, the squad leader held up his hand and whispered, "Stop, goblins—what's that sound?"

name: Mogg Toady
text:
Mogg Toady can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Mogg Toady can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.

text:

name: Mogis, God of Slaughter
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to black and red is less than seven, Mogis isn't a creature.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Mogis deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices a creature.

name: Mogis's Marauder
text: When Mogis's Marauder enters the battlefield, up to X target creatures each gain intimidate and haste until end of turn, where X is your devotion to black. (A creature with intimidate can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it. Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)

name: Mogis's Warhound
text:
Bestow {2}{R} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Mogis's Warhound attacks each turn if able.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

name: Mold Adder
text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Mold Adder.

editions.flavor: The more you struggle against its coils, the tighter they get.

name: Mold Demon
text: When Mold Demon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Swamps.

name: Molder
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. You gain X life.

editions.flavor:
"The forests have succumbed to ruin, but the spirit of Krosa remains alive and vital in these devouring spores."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Molder Beast
text:
Trample
Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Molder Beast gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"A trail of scrap metal can lead it into an ambush. But take care not to overfeed it."
—Adaran, Tangle hunter

name: Molder Slug
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact.

editions.flavor: Fortunately for it, Mirrodin is a plane without salt.

name: Moldervine Cloak
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
